{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

For a matrix

{% raw %}

matrix[source]

matrix(matrix:Union[list, ndarray], decimal_sep_replacement:Optional[bool]='_')

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

It can be used on lists,

{% raw %} 
matrix([[1, 2], [3,4]])

'1234'
{% endraw %}

or arrays

{% raw %} 
matrix(np.array([[1, 2], [3,4]]))

'1234'
{% endraw %}

Decimal separators are by default replaced.

{% raw %} 
matrix(np.array([[1.1, 2.2], [3.3,4.4]]))

'1_12_23_34_4'
{% endraw %}

Lists are also fine.

{% raw %} 
matrix([1.3, 2.4])

'1_32_4'
{% endraw %}

For a number

{% raw %}

number[source]

number(number:Union[float, float64], decimal_sep_replacement:Optional[bool]='_')

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
number(3.14)

'3_14'
{% endraw %}

For a string

From this post: a function to hash any arbitray string.

{% raw %}

string[source]

string(s:str)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
string('foo-bar#baz?qux@127/\\9]')

'foobarbazqux1279'
{% endraw %}
